intro: Garnotia cheesemanii var. rarotongensis, commonly known as the Cook Islands starlingtree, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
